all comic are political i find that sentiment all comic are political a lil odd if you don t mind me giving my personal opinion whenever i read comic like the injustice series a one example i never really thought there wa any politics in it in fact i detected more philosophical theme than anything political particularly on the moral philosophy of batman s deontological ethic and superman s unfortunate utilitarianism the interesting part of course is that these philosophical theme didn t try to present themselves a the main point either because the comic managed to include relatable real life like drama of what and how it would seem to be a superhero with those stake on the line either it s mainly an american thing where you guy consider politics to be somewhat similar to philosophy or any general aphorism in life or there isn t actually politics in the comic i read

adjacent the only good thing i feel we got out of that wa ultimate spider man and even then plenty of issue i only really remember watching the later season and got pretty good vibe from what it wa trying to do despite the flaw which i didn t gaf about at the time i loved it recent cartoon are terrible and they just feel like they re made to advertise the mcu and have horribly animation like they expected none of the audience to care the only good thing we got in a while wa spider verse marvel used to have a bigger variety of these cartoon and other non mcu content that could stand on it own leg not to mention the total lack of x men and fantastic four stuff during the majority of last decade on top of everything being mcu ad dc these day like to make stand alone animated adaptation of comic book story spin offs that treat all it lore like mythology they ve dominated everything except live action movie instead they just feel like soulless ad with no level of creativity we had a deadpool cartoon coming up but it got axed bc disney didn t like it something called tigra and dazzler too i hear hit monkey got a cartoon but i haven t watched it yet imo it look closer to the kind of thing dc would do with their hero if anyone s seen it please tell me so or otherwise a for their game it feel like that all dried up a the mcu picked up steam spider man wa a great game but it wa a console exclusive and the only good marvel game that decade that wasn t delisted gotg wa also pretty nice but avenger fucked up the perception of it and they probably won t be able to spring off of that any further marvel infinite wa just a big mcu ad there s just such a terrible lack in variety in anything that isn t live action and anything that is live action need to be mcu adjacent i hope in quick thought on m marvel finale alright now for the season finale of m marvel and it s not great now on paper the idea of kamala going out of her way to save a colored powered individual from a corrupt system of authority is a great one and at time it kind of work that is it work when it s kamala and kamran with kamala doing her own damage control ha against kamran s attempt to really hurt people that result in some fun and tense action when it come to kamala s friend trying to mess with damage control like they re meddling kid in an episode of scooby doo it s a little too silly like nothing that they ve done should have worked but the main issue that no normal ha isn t anything that happens in this episode it s everything that happened in the series that build up to it kamran having power isn t really a bad idea but how he got them involved this long and convoluted process that when you sit down and think about it doesn t make much sense it s almost a if it would have been better if he had power to begin with maybe through something like i don t know through a terrigen gas bomb that gave random people in the city superpower and forcing kamala to deal with them something that happened in the comic and that you could use future series movie to explain why such an event happened in the first place just a thought and hey if they did go the terrigen gas route it would also do a great job in building up damage control a the final threat they barely got any focus in this series all because all the attention went to the schmuck who died in the previous episode if we spent time with sargent what s her face dealing with other powered individual and being hostile to the one that are coincidentally people of color then we d have a decent villain that make for the perfect antagonist for kamala given both character background but no we needed to have this completely unnecessary story line smooshed into the series just so we can establish why m marvel is powerful enough to be an avenger by the way can we please stop this idea that a hero need to save the world to establish why they should be an avenger it hurt shang chi and the legend of the ten ring it hurt moon knight and it destroyed m marvel a hero doesn t need to save the world to prove that they re worth being one of earth s mightiest hero ant man spider man and black panther s solo movie were about them fighting villain who s motivation were to give dangerous weapon to others it s not world ending but it could still do a lot of damage to a lot of innocent people and that s fine kamala didn t need to fight these inter dimensional being who could potentially destroy everything in getting back home not when fighting damage control could be just a important and lead to an incredible message about a corrupt system in law enforcement the world doesn t need to be saved when helping a small number of people could do just a much good after all whoever save one person it is a if he ha saved all of mankind yusuf khan from the comic which do in fact matter a a whole the finale s a mess which make sense because the whole series is a mess too a far a i can tell m marvel nail the spirit of the character but it failed the most important aspect of her http www tumblr com blog view ordinaryschmuck source share and i do love the character expect for the boring and forgettable villain hell i ve kept saying that the best part of m marvel are the moment that make these character feel human especially the moment involving kamala s friend and family and the muslim arabic heritage if this wa just a series about an over imaginative girl who learned to appreciate her heritage and the people around her it d get an easy a for effort but it isn t it s a superhero series that try way too hard to be grand and epic when something small and personal would have fit much better so a is i d say m marvel s a maybe a if i wanted to be nice i don t know phase four of the mcu really is a mess and it s evident that marvel studio are focusing more on quantity than quality nothing they ve made is really that bad but they definitely need to take a break take a breath and reconsider what fan want from this franchise

my problem with the mcu s treatment of the multiverse my main problem is the blantant ignoring of earth a a designation for the mcu earth is and ha been the mainline comic universe for decade decade meaning there is and ha been one marvel multiverse for decade this is supported by spider verse and spider geddon which both feature cameo from cartoon and movie character with their own reality designation a iman vellani said if the mcu is earth then kamala is an inhuman and aside from the inhumans tv series and black bolt of earth if that really is the true designation seeing a apparently different universe call other universe different thing they don t exist in the mcu or at least the terrigen bomb which awakened her latent inhuman gene and power didn t this is unlike dc s multiverse which combine the main universe along with their previous incarnation and variation with the dark multiverse and other multiverses across all of their medium including the arrowverse dceu etc into their multi multiverse or omniverse the term omniverse is flawed because it comprises all version of reality real and imagined including ours which would include the entirety of the marvel multiverse however this can be easily explained away there are multiple crossover earth that are therefore part of both the dc and marvel multiverse meaning that it can be assumed that the rest of the other publisher s mulitverse exists but is understandably not able to be shown due to ownership and copyright so let s say marvel decides to make their multiverse like this ignoring year of history fine they still don t know the difference between alternate timeline possible future and alternate universe i am convinced that the writer don t actually read the comic and get most of their knowledge from the internet for example the timeline steve returned to in endgame should theoretically be an alternate timeline to the main or a every theory is calling it now but i refuse by the logic of loki this should be a different universe so how is steve able live to be old in the main timeline this should be a possible future and while possible future can be alternate universe time travel altering the timeline is not a reason for example earth the universe shared an identical history with earth the comic one but one event in it timeline caused a change that spiraled into the state it s in now also i ve heard people use america chavez never seeing a version of herself in another universe a evidence that it s a separate multiverse but by definition the multiverse is infinite she ha just yet to visit a universe where another version of herself exists i m also convinced marvel doesn t fully know it own universe in nwh we see villain from the mcguire and garfield film however their history is inconsistent with their counterpart from those film their transport to the mcu wa similar to in that though the universe ha a shared history that event in their timeline caused a new universe to splinter out without influence from another unlike loki would lead you to believe time is non linear so when this universe wa created at that point it had always existed separately and yet marvel treated this a the same universe alternate timeline similar universe but not the same this is unlike how tobey and andrew appeared in the movie they were pulled directly from their universe in present time not altering the history and therefore not creating an alternate timeline anyways thank you for indulging my rant

discussion garfield logan the sensitive soul with a big heart gar logan hold a special place in my heart for many reason whether it s his enduring positivity in the face of grief and trauma childlike joy in using his animal power or remaining true to his offbeat self in spite of others telling him to get serious i ve always found the character a source of comfort recently i found one of the best profile i ve seen of gar http www cbr com teen titan beast boy gay that connects some of these dot making a case for his continued relevance and future potential putting aside the clickbaity title some thoughtful point are made and pattern emerge in how he relates to others the key premise is gt beast boy is an incredibly romantic person at heart someone who love to love and yearns to be loved he s a sensitive soul with love for everyone in his heart the author go a step further to describe gar a a queer coded character i think this is open to interpretation i happen to agree but at the very least these quality are rarely represented in male character in comic and to me they re quite welcome and important notably the author leaf sexual attraction out of the analysis completely focusing on the queer aspect of simply being outside the norm in how one approach romance platonic friendship or expression of love in general i think very few recognize this aspect of gar certainly not at dc a long a grim dark story sell his potential will continue to be overlooked but i think story with more heart indeed where being a cheerful goof is a super power would find an audience in these bleak disconnected time a a peculiar sort myself i always assumed my take on gar existed only in my own mind but perhaps others see it too anyone feel the same

best dc comic for somebody not really into mainstream superheroes i m not totally against them in fact i love a lot of batman s stuff but i ve never been into all the really tropey good guy v bad guy super hero action it just isn t deep enough for me i love a well developed story and or world and a great character is a necessity i prefer somebody who isn t omnipotent or ha obvious plot armor somebody who struggle a we all do and i prefer the threat around them to be well developed a well i can get around the threat if the protagonist s are well developed but somebody who ha fallen into evil for a very relatable human desire i often find most compelling for example the reason i like batman a lot is everything around him is well developed we have the entirety of gotham city with all it nook and cranny full of malicious intent waiting to be uncovered many of the villain fell into their persona due to their own fall from grace mental illness or greed and batman himself is only a human with fancy gadget a well a a traumatized child and a victim to the worst kind of robbery life so for those of you who enjoy a well developed narrative similarly what have you enjoyed my mind is fresh within dc a well a comic in general so please nothing that requires too much if any background knowledge

is there anywhere left for the mcu to explore conceptually hey everyone it should go without saying that i love the mcu movie and i m not trying to critique i kind of have an existential concern for the franchise part of what made the mcu movie so appealing to non comic book fan audience besides just being great movie in general wa that the movie did a great job of adapting comic book style story telling into movie format foreshadowing cross over serialized story event etc this type of story telling wa immensly well received climaxing with endgame which i think is an appitome of the type of comic story telling they had been doing foreshadowing and building towards event movie you could say is something unique to this series and what ha kept movie fan invested for all those year during the infinity saga the problem is how many different type of event can you do without becoming redundant like if marvel decided to build towards another big baddie essentially an analog for thanos like god doom or maybe even kang i don t think people would care a much it would inevitably just be compared to infinity war and endgame i guess unless the stake of the story were pretty different i feel like the most comic story trope have been used already because there ha already been such a great variety of story already told in the mcu conceptually is there much else to explore with these comic style story i am kind of doubtful even with superhero comic we see the story usually follow certain trope and storyline the interesting one have variation but it is kind of similar nonetheless and the people that really enjoy these story become the comic book fan when this happens some may think it already ha with the movie the perception among movie fan probably will be that the next upcoming film is just another marvel movie instead of the next exciting blockbuster film what can they do about this not sure if they can recapture the magic of the infinity saga again but they can keep creating quality film maybe get experimental like how some comic are recent film have kind of been doing this doe that defeat the purpose of having an interconnected series kind of but the movie can t be propped up with that a the gimmick i hope they can continue their success in bringing crazy comic book concept and story to the big screen including some more awesome event movie i wa hoping for a house of m avenger movie a i thought that would be unique enough and elizabeth olsen is a great actress but i doubt we are getting that now because we kind of already did get it secret invasion could be really tense but there are some similarity to winter solder original sin could be a good way to do an event but keep it character centric god bless if you read through my rambly thought i got thinking about this because i am excited for the upcoming thor movie but have not been a interested in the disney stuff and some of the phase movie i m not expecting cinema history to be broken with thor but i like chris hemsworth s take and i am hoping to see more of the norse mythology stuff from the comic in it ultimately i think this will be the forseeable future of the mcu s appeal more individual character centric tldr i feel like adaptation of comic book story telling to film is what made the mcu uniquely appealing and got people excited to follow along a we hadn t seen that with film before but that can t be a selling point forever or else it becomes a gimmick which defeat some of the purpose of the mcu instead they should focus on just making good superhero movie superhero story have their trope and usually follow similar plot so unfortunately it might just be considered more of the same and just another marvel movie then superhero movie might become kind of niche again i have a unpopular opinion about hulk that should be common knowledge i m tired of hearing this so here we go mark ruffalo s hulk look nothing like a ape hulk ha the same facial feature and bone anatomy a any human it s just that his skull structure is proportionally exaggerated yes hulk s brown ridge chin and upper lip are supposed to be over exaggerated hulk and jack kirby purposely made hulk like this because they took some inspiration from frankenstein s for hulk s physical design some people still say because of this he look like an ape and well anatomically that s still not true the whole skull of a gorilla differs from regular human amp hulk s skull for so many reason gorilla have a large sagittal crest on the top of their skull which give them the cone head appearance hulk doesn t have a gorilla cone head lol hulk s skull shape is the same a a human just slightly sloped and the brown ridge is larger gorilla have proportionately big canine teeth but hulk doesn t his teeth are usually portrayed a being proportionally smaller than regular human in comparison to his overall face gorilla have prognathism giving them a protruding face but hulk doesn t have that his upper lip is longer than the average human s but his face is still flat like a human and doesn t protrude extremely gorilla have receding chin but hulk s chin is pronounced the only thing that you could say is ape like about hulk are his mannerism but that s comic accurate

for grab a long a their story and action are not altered amp x b hey all i have been seeing a lot of passionate discussion about valid representation of character in particular dick grayson in regard to their cultural heritage v canonical traditional depiction i wa curious to gather some wider opinion on the matter rather than just the one i ve been seeing in the last three post regarding gabriel larrag n s artwork mainly how important is a character s visual identity compared to their identity a a whole i think the discussion in those aforementioned thread wa becoming very racial in nature so i wanted to point some thing out and find out how others feel i think in comic book especially the superhero persona give a lot of freedom in term of the expression of the pedestrian alter ego for example while bruce wayne is usually depicted a tall and muscular there is a variety in his actual build over time you have frank miller and ben affleck portrayal where bruce is very built and you have christian bale and david mazzucchelli depiction where he ha a leaner build so at what point do we stop recognizing the character a bruce wayne a lot of people are saying that you can t change dick grayson from white or white passing to more visually representative of a romani an indo aryan ethnicity with asian root heritage if you take that stance then why doesn t it apply to other physical trait the difference in build i listed above or let s go further is hair color an acceptable change is hair color a bigger part of identity than build often artist depiction of dark hair character will range from brown to black is ezra miller s flash a objectionable a a darker complexion dick grayson shouldn t actor dye their hair or wear wig to better match the source material going back to ethnicity ca cain is canonically biracial i recognize that s different than being th romani when romani people can also just be white passing i also recognize that is significantly more nuanced than simple skin tone but i would say her artistic depiction have a pretty wide range from very asian to very white i think basically the point i m trying to make is that it s easy to say a character can be depicted any way you want or a character ha to be depicted a they are traditionally within the cannon at the same time if it is just a matter of wanting better representation isn t it not more preferable to create brand new character

thought on the end of grant morrison s batman a lot of people view the end of gm amazing run on batman a bleak and depressing i don t think it is i get that batman is stuck in an ouroborus of lonliness and struggle against evil but i don t understand why he cannot be happy doing it it s much like sisyphus from albert camus myth of sisyphus sisyphus is trapped in a cycle not unlike batman yet camus encourages his audience to imagine sisyphus happy and if i ve learned anything from gm work it s that imagination is more important than reality batman may be alone at the end of the story but he won t be alone forever i believe he can grow with his peer maybe he will grow he still ha dick gordon and alfred even though he sends him on vacay i believe the end of morrison s run show that even though evil will always exist so will the idea of u our myth we can create meaning in the cycle of struggle and meaninglessness we can move forward together

fun fact the japanese spider man series led to the creation of power ranger under a year licensing deal with toei company yes that toei who s animation company make such great a dragon ball sailor moon and one piece the next series they produced following supaidaman wa battle fever j it is now known a the rd super sentai series but back then it wa considered the first ignoring the creation of shotaro ishinomori that were himitsu sentai goranger and jakq dengekitai due to licensing right shotaro ishinomori also created kamen rider a sister series to super sentai both of which continue to this day and are part of a genre called tokusatsu which not only includes superhero production but kaiju movie such a godzilla and gamera battle fever j wa also the first sentai series to feature a giant robo mecha or what we in the west know a a zord megazord with the success of battle fever j and the other marvel produced show denshi senttai denjiman and taiyo sentai sun vulcan the super sentai franchise wa able to continue a it doe to this day haim saban while in japan on a business trip spotted the th th at the time super sentai series choudenshi bioman on tv he wa like i can make money off of this by dubbing it over and so year later in filming for the american segment of the first season of mighty morphin power ranger began taking stock footage from the th th at the time super sentai series kyoryu sentai zyuranger fun fact stan lee also saw a sentai series whilst in japan one time but when he brought it to the network they turned it down so somewhere in this ever expanding multiverse there s a world where stan lee created power ranger and it wa created way before the s anyway the suit stuck for the next two season with the only element they took from the consecutive sentai being the mecha from gosei sentai dairanger and ninja sentai kakuranger for season and respectively a well a the white ranger suit coming from dairanger the alien ranger of aquitar were also adapted from the kakurangers for the most part power ranger ha continued to adapt from sentai although not entirely in order and jumping around a bit in recent year tl dr the japanese spider man series wa part of a licensing deal with marvel that sparked super sentai season which helped boost the already rapidly growing popularity so much that haim saban saw it in japan and year later took footage from these series legally of course to dub over and create power ranger

how dc ha treated tim over the year is shameful so after eleven year tim drake is finally getting an ongoing series but even a a longtime tim drake fan i am just not excited at all and that is mainly because of how dc ha handled and treated tim over the past decade he wa one of the best character in the batfamily post crisis in my opinion the reason why he wa so great wa because of his growth a a character going from robin to red robin however ever since the new he s ha struggled to stay relevant he got put into a teen titan book that nobody read or liked his origin got retconned everything that wa great about the character felt like it wa stripped away i assume this wa all dan didio s handiwork in rebirth in james tynion s run on detective a lot of what he lost in the new got restored somewhat like his origin his relationship with steph but during james tynion s run he wa also killed off and wa therefore sidelined for awhile when you wanted to see mire of him after that he started appearing in young justice in which bendis started hyping up his new identity which i wa also pretty excited for fan came up with so many name but the result wa so disappointing then after that series got cancelled he just stayed in limbo for awhile making sporadic appearance here and there this is something that ha happened with him a lot ever since his solo got cancelled in new and it s so frustrating for a fan to see his favorite character just disappear from comic altogether then we got the urban legend story which wa controversial some of people liked it some people hated it i personally didn t have a problem with it the only problem i have with it wa how they ended his relationship with steph if it actually meant he would get more spotlight and attention from dc but after that story came out there wa a lot of month of just absolutely nothing he fell into a limbo again finally the solo series wa eventually announced and the choice of the writer really doesn t make me wanna read it the recently released young justice issue wa quite bad with many character written out of character and the pride special wasn t great either i really want the series to be good but i just don t think it s going to be i hope that his relationship with barnard doesn t take priority over him being a superhero because at the end of the day it s a series about a superhero and him being a superhero should take priority above all else

thor need to stop being comedic thor love and thunder just like ragnarok i found to be full of bad comedy that not even a year old would laugh at there wa perhaps or decent joke in there the comedy expertise of taika waititi is doing the thor character more damage than good by turning him back into the moron he wa at the beginning of thor in thor there wa an interesting and serious arc where thor went from a proud and idiotic prince to a much more sensible and caring hero recent movie have turned thor into at best a moron and at worst a joke thor in my opinion also had better presentation than ragnarok the visuals of asgard in the opening of thor were brilliant and truly portrayed asgard a a realm of god and hero while ragnarok simply lack the awe inspiring golden glory of asgard and make it seem more like just another cool planet recent movie have not done thor any favor it wa clear that kenneth branagh had a much more vivid picture of asgard and he wa able to very beautifully translate that picture into film in my opinion taika waititi specialises in comedy and his intentionally funny movie are absolutely amazing but the thor character wa not supposed to be funny therefore i feel that he wa the wrong choice for this movie franchise and that marvel either need to tone down the comedy or bring back kenneth branagh i didn t hate love and thunder but i found it to be a bit mediocre it had very good aspect to it but there are a lot of way in which it could be improved and i hope that thor and any of his future movie improve on this

my somewhat comprehensive reading order i got back into reading comic about a year ago and wa a bit overwhelmed i got the dc infinite app and tried jumping into various book of character i loved it wa frustrating always feeling like i wa missing context and background and so i began researching various reading order i eventually stumbled on mikesamazingworld com they have a catalogue of every dc book released and their cover i decided i would start at crisis on infinite earth and go from there i read through the dc infinite compilation and then plugged in the date at the end to mike somewhere around too lazy to check forgive me and sorted by publication date i read about of the title from each month skipping one that arent on the app or that dont really interest me ill read one go back to the mike page and find the next im at the tale end of and having a great time reading some lesser known run or old classic ive missed it a big undertaking but i have enjoyed myself immensely and reccomend this to anyone looking for a big project how do you pick what to read aside from grabbing current title do you think im crazy thought in general i have loved reading the old question run and brynes superman stuff a it s all fresh to me recent favorite are the old peacemaker miniseries and sword of the atom way late to the oarty but perez wonder woman is great too

what if all the robin were a single person who had a huge character arc this is just a thought that i had but i always found it weird that batman had multiple robin which is to say that multiple different people took on the vigilante persona of robin starting with dick grayson who wa then replaced by jason todd who wa then replaced by tim drake who wa then replaced by damian wayne while i know the meta reason this happened wa to keep the dynamic robin had with batman fresh and interesting a well a give room for various robin to grow out of the role and into their own people it still just never sat right with me i almost saw it a batman essentially shopping for a new robin once his old one had moved on which just seems wrong while i know that s a bit of an oversimplification that doesn t do the context of each new robin recruitment justice it s still how i feel thus i wa wondering what other people think about the idea of all the various robin dick jason tim and damian being one character while that might sound a little unclear here s sort of what i had in mind this single unified robin would be the assassin son of batman and talia al ghul and would slowly gain humanity via becoming robin a vigilante sidekick to his father later deciding in spite of this that the joker wa too evil for any kind of mercy unlike the rest of the rogue and thus attempting to put him down for good only to fail and get beaten to death later being revived by a lazarus pit due to being the grandson of ra s al ghul becoming mentally disturbed and returning to gotham in order to kill all the criminal including the joker being stopped by his father who would help him move past his trauma in the aftermath deciding to leave gotham behind in favor of finding a new purpose in his life due to all he had been through eventually teaming up with other young vigilante sidekick and deciding to create a superhero team with them known a the titan a he spent time with them his broken soul would mend back together figuratively and literally and he would become a healthy mature young man taking on the moniker of nightwing and becoming a much more upbeat and hopeful superhero instead of a glum and serious one so a you can see this hypothetical single unified robin is basically an amalgamation of all the different robin put into a single character that go on what is surprisingly enough a pretty good character arc that fit together rather nicely thought

after seeing doctor strange mom do you believe marvel will ever give u a mcu version apparently illuminati it wa great seeing the illuminati in mom especially reed and xavier but the whole takeaway of that film from my reading being that our strange is the sort of ultimate version the strangest strange if you will seemed to imply that he would never stoop to such ethically dubious decision making a his multiversal counterpart that let the pressure get to them on the other hand however the fact that the mcu is bringing in this new batch of younger hero seems to hint at a future schism amongst the marvel hero ala the comic story where the young avenger grow disillusioned with their legacy counterpart increasingly unethical and anti heroic action kamala khan in particular is a huge part of this story a are wiccan and speedball plus our peter parker is still young inexperienced enough despite having already participated in a universal war he is still very much in his friendly neighborhood phase to take the mile morale role of that story honesty kamala in particular with her avenger hero worship seems to be tailor made for this role of being the true believer that ha finally lost faith eventually a seen in the recent fluster cluck that wa the ea avenger game counterpoint to the counterpoint marvel seems very unwilling to make their top billed mcu character take on a le than heroic persona wanda being some kinda dirty in mom notwithstanding a evidenced by the nixing of stark s infamous demon in a bottle story now this point may be the weakest a i m sure many fan can and likely will point out how dumb i am for forgetting the myriad example of mcu hero acting in an anti heroic manner but it seemed worth pointing out regardless i d love to hear other fan thought on this a it would be great to see an mcu prime illuminati one day if only because i won t be able to die happy until i ve seen mark ruffalo get a world war hulk story so we can see world breaker hulk in the mcu

miss my comic i see a lot of people sharing old comic on here here s my story so i began collecting comic when i wa seven my grandparent owned a small variety store and every weekend i d go work saturday and sunday it wa menial task such a stock the can wipe down shelving stack newspaper but every time i d finish my grandmother would let me pick one comic a chocolate milk and a chocolate bar so over a year i d collected quite a few and this went on for five plus year but when i wa ten i d gone to my other grandparent with my father and my uncle wa cleaning junk out of his old room i use junk a a loose term here a he had milk crate full of comic from the late sixty early seventy i asked if i could have them hand he said yup and gave them all to me so by the time i wa ten i had s of comic and mostly marvel some of the comic i had were avenger incredible hulk fantastic four first time with dr doom spider man first time with the punisher for that i had the original and the reprint from the s anyways all of these comic were in bag with cardboard backing and at least were in fair to good shape we ll fast forward twenty year and my basement flood while my wife and i are gone on vacation those comic by the time we got home were destroyed and by destroyed i mean mulch in the plastic bag they d basically just deteriorated into nothingness contact my insurance company and they told me without proof of the price of them they could only give me the bottom price on all pretty sure i wa sitting on approx k worth of comic and ended up getting k for the insurance money and that included other property that got ruined i miss my comic so thanks for sharing yours it make me very nostalgic

saw thor love and thunder spoiler i know the movie wa supposed to be more comedic so i ll avoid commenting about the actual content of how it wa portrayed what i m going to take issue with is some of the plot hole that presented themselves i ll attach a spoiler tag but allow me to also provide another spoiler warning jane using mjolnir i m fine with her using mjolnir to become a thor but the fact that she us a broken mjolnir at all raise some question the piece called to her and the movie itself admitted that the piece were immovable this mean that they maintained the enchantment to only be moved by the worthy which is explained away by thor having mjolnir protect her my issue stand with that she can move and operate the hammer a if it never were destroyed with the exception of being able to break it apart on command thor then is able to lift the hammer in it reassembled state so when hela destroyed it why did he act like his weapon wa gone forever the piece were right there clearly still enchanted and able to be reformed and wielded by him did the hammer decide it didn t like thor anymore he had to forge stormbreaker because his hammer wa broken but jane wa able to just pick up the piece and use them why didn t he did he just decide that the hammer wasn t worth using anymore wish granting eternity the movie establishes that thor know that eternity exists heck even valkyrie knew about it granted you need the bifrost to get there so thor wouldn t have been able to access eternity until the end of infinity war but directly after the snap thanos destroys the infinity stone and retires thor show up and pop his head off all well and good wouldn t this be the perfect time to go and wish everyone back the stone are gone thanos is dead there is apparently no one guarding eternity unless gorr killed the guard off screen which even if he did i m sure the remaining hero post snap could probably handle any resistance thor could go in and wish everyone back wish thanos never snapped or really any number of counter wish instead thor wait year because he forgot he didn t feel like it would rather partake in time travel shenanigan thor can grant thor power i wa under the impression that jane wa using mjolnir a the source of her thor power but apparently thor can just grant his power to anyone not even a single person either he can grant his power to just over a dozen child he did specify that it wa temporary but it felt like it wa because he didn t want super powered kid running around not out of lack of ability to give them permanently wa thor only able to do this because he held the bolt how did he know the bolt could do this why did the bolt work for him at all you would think someone like zeus would have a similar worthy enchantment on his greatest weapon or at the very least a only function for me enchantment so i ll assume thor can just hand these ability out willy nilly i know shooter mcpokeysticks and redhead twistythighs would certainly benefit from some thor power even if he can only do it temporarily why not give everyone a thor boost before battle i have other issue but these three seemed like the largest glaring problem that contradict other lore already set up by the other movie i m curious what you folk think or if you have theory on how why these plot hole actually work thanks for reaching the end of my rant

continent she us myrina a former amazon who left the island prior to diana s birth to work a an assassin on man s isle to fuel the conflict myrina is killed in battle by the amazon phillipus during intergang weaponry who wa inspired by superman to don a colorful persona for his activity believing him to be the first of the aryan ubermensch that the nazi regime spoke of secondly he and lois investigate the weapon distribution ring intergang and expose moxie mannheim a their leader finally a lexcorp scientist named joseph martin ha his metagene activated and becomes the atomic skull following an accident orchestrated by lex luthor so he could lure out superman fascinated by and envious of the man of steel superman battle the atomic skull in the heart of metropolis this film is an anthology containing three separate story connected by plot thread such a intergang and superman s growing influence over the people of metropolis which culminates into a climax in which the people of metropolis help superman in his battle against atomic skull batman phosphorus in this film batman face dr alexander sartorius better known a dr phosphorus whose metagene wa activated following an accident in a nuclear power plant phosphorus blackmail the gotham city council by threatening to expose the council s covering up the accident that made him in order to establish himself a a key to impact metahumans using weapon that target the gene the film feature the formation of the league to stop the dominators lex luthor assist the justice league interested in the dominators research into the metagene at the end of the film lex begin a program to house metahumans experimented on by the dominators and help develop their power in order to further his own nefarious end it is revealed james gunn didn t do the gotg justice i m gonna preface this by saying i actually like most of jame s work suicide squad peacemaker although i think that show had some major flaw and i actually think the guardian movie pretty decent a a fun turn off your brain watch that being said i have some major issue with the way james characterizes the guardian right off the bat let s all agree that drax and groot aren t even really character they are both textbook definition of one note and every chance at them getting any amount of development seemed to be traded for a cheep laugh everyone will remember i am groot and the why is gamora and invisible drax joke but no one actually care about the character they came from because there s nothing to care about rocket raccoon i thought wa well done actually no note gamora is cool when she isn t just being peter girlfriend james gunn seems to really like the idiot boy meet badass girl trope which i m not a fan of and gamora seems to be thoroughly stuck in the badass girl dating idiot boy role i think her arc with nebula wa good and i wish we got more of that her being killed off while implying thanos did truly love her then bringing back a version wa some of the most wtf writing i ve ever seen but go off i guess mantis hasn t had a whole lot of screen time but i feel like she s going in the same direction a drax and groot where pom s performance is so bubbly and cute that she just get used for audience pleasing joke instead of real character growth thor screenshots have shown that she ll be doing something with thor so hopefully it s more serious nebula wa cool no note yondu wa cool although not sure why they made it seem like he wa actually a good father figure in the end while spending movie telling u he wasn t but go off and finally peter quill despite being the the main guardian and the protagonist of both guardian movie star lord fall into the same trap a drax and groot half the time peter could be developing a a character he s instead being made the butt of a joke that joke being that he s stupid hence idiot boy meet badass girl trope a much a i love pre comic starlord i m not mad that his outfit weaponry and personality were changed i m just mad they made him stupid and a joke the best part about pre comic peter wa that he wa an intelligent leader who had the respect of people way stronger than him fine make him a goofy space pirate but i hate that he s an idiot who no one respect despite being the leader of the guardian for the first movie fine but that should ve changed after or even during the second movie so yeah i guess my main issue with these character is how often making a joke trump character development but these are just my opinion i d like to hear opinion on these character

is it just me or most of the current marvel comic are pretty good maybe i m in a good mood lately but i feel like the comic are firing on most cylinder right now on the x men side we ve got immortal x men which is honestly fantastic and for my money much better than hickman s ongoing x men red is excellent ewing never miss and legion of x and duggan s x men are pretty good too then we have jed mackay consistently knocking it out of the park with moon knight strange and most surprisingly iron cat though that s only a surprise for those who haven t read his black cat series because the guy writes the best felicia captain america by kelly and lanzig is just starting but already feel like the best cap run since brubaker steve s voice in this is perfect and there s an almost hickman esque vibe to the complex plot what else venom is excellent when ewing is writing ewing never miss x and ram v s carnage is a real nice neo noir crime story meet cosmic horror and speaking of horror percy s ghost rider is one of the best horror comic on stand these day i dropped cates godawful thor ongoing but gronbekk s jane foster and the mighty thor is giving me the epic mythology driven thor series i wanted shame it s just a mini i feel like i m forgetting some stuff but overall i m pleased with the current selection of comic regardless of a few bad apple black panther avenger thor hulk

where is gotham city in new jersey gotham city is most often depicted a being located in new jersey but just where in the state depends on the source the atlas for the mayfair dc hero rpg from the s s place it on the atlantic coast in roughly the same location a tom river while the oft cited panel from the world s greatest superheroes issue place on delaware bay vaguely around maurice river which location make more sense overall

thought on venom what are your thought on this movie it s definitely no masterpiece by any mean not even close hardy doe well with what he ha to work with ha fun with it all i mean the man is entertaining no matter what c mon he made eddie his own and did very well with venom himself venom is really a badass character in this movie and definitely the next one thankfully he wa a lot more realized in the sequel given a lot more screen time and more to do with this movie and let there be carnage they really should have called it rise of carnage or something that title is so wordy venom is a lot closer to past version of him i ve seen in past stuff like game and the s cartoon hell if anything he s closest to the version of venom in the p spider man game and it work very well he s got this over the top personality ha fun in the thing he doe say we his goofy a lot and is intimidating when he want to be a for complaint about this movie the writing definitely needed a lot better writing a lot of thing did not make sense riot going across the world for a long a he did inside of this very elderly woman on foot the whole time when before her he wa inside this very fresh young woman also the dialogue wow the majority of it wa absolutely terrible and it wa delivered so idek how to describe it i mean most of the dialogue between eddie and venom wa passable to good but other than that yikes and the fight between venom and riot wa really fucking bad shit lighting and overall visuals sludge like fighting between to dark colored cgi symbiotes this movie is very messy but decent for what it is hardy definitely make it watchable and venom is very nice to watch and that swat scene wa easily one of the best part in my possibly very unpopular opinion let there be carnage doe vastly improve on the many problem i have with this movie and holy shit wa that big fight near the end badass compared to venom v riot

july book club nomination original graphic novel here we ll vote for the book to be featured in the july book club you may nominate or upvote book that you wish to discus do not nominate more than one book and do not post a duplicate nomination like with our character of the month poll each poll will have a particular theme or category this week s category is original graphic novel nominate story that were published not a serialized comic issue but directly a full length graphic novel they may be original graphic novel or extended one shot that are collected and published by themselves a standalone book guideline for book eligibility are a follows the book must be widely available in print this mean that i should be able to go to an online retailer like amazon instocktrades or book depository and buy it without paying an exorbitant markup the book must be available digitally ie comixology dc universe or hoopla digital either a a complete collection or individual issue it must be available through legal mean do not post a piracy site the book should be reasonably affordable paperback trade hardcover and deluxe edition are fine absolute and omnibus are not if you re nominating a story arc be sure to include the trade where it s collected do not nominate a single issue or annual limit your nomination to a single collection or graphic novel don t just nominate an entire run pick out one particular volume under certain circumstance we may allow two volume from a single creative run to be nominated if they re reasonably short and tell a complete story e g a issue mini series split up into two trade however this is left to moderator discretion anything published by dc is eligible that includes main line comic graphic novel imprint such a vertigo medium tie in and others only nominate a book if you re genuinely interested in reading and discussing it there s no prize for picking the most popular answer book club archive http www reddit com r dccomics wiki book club

day two of making my way down this subreddit s recommended comic list batgirl year one hi yesterday i started a series where i go down this subreddit s list of recommended comic for newbie http www reddit com r dccomics wiki recommended newbie and review one item each day yesterday s entry wa about aquaman volume the trench by geoff john you can read that entry here http www reddit com r dccomics wiki recommended newbie today s item wa batgirl year one by chuck dixon and scott beatty it tell the story of barbara s journey to becoming batgirl i thoroughly enjoyed this book i haven t read batgirl a much a i ve read batman but i tend to really enjoy the batgirl book i do read except whatever the fuck that new bird of prey run wa and this wa no exception unlike that fucking bop run i really love her character and i find the whole concept behind barbara super interesting i like the way her relationship with robin is depicted i m a dickbabs shipper fight me and i loved how barbara developed over the course of this story i particularly loved dixon and beatty s portrayal of killer moth they made him come off sort of pathetic and down on his luck like an alchoholic spider man dressed like a beetle i wa kind of rooting for him at time firefly came off really menacing and unhinged which played well with killer moth s characterization it seems like the new batgirl movie will be borrowing element from this run with killer moth and everything which just make me even more excited one thing i felt wa a bit unnecessary wa black canary s inclusion she just kind of popped up and disappeared a few panel at this point in the dc chronology i don t know that batman and the justice league would even have a watchtower yet but maybe that s just my dumb headcanon getting in the way make sure to leave your thought on this comic down below i ll probably skip hush since i ve already read it about three time so tomorrow s entry will be batman year one

what version of the teen titan do you think would work best for a cinematic adaptation in a hypothetical rebooted dceu for me i think a combination of the new teen titan and the teen titan would be the best choice for the big screen why well the new teen titan are by far the most iconic and popular version of the team period a big reason for this being that it introduced unique story and character that helped the team differentiate itself from the justice league e g trigon juda contract etcetera thereby giving them an identity of their own instead of just having them be watered down version of their mentor but why do i say that the teen titan run should be combined with this well for one because i personally think superboy should also be on the team considering how iconic he is a well a how great his origin story is what with being tied to the death of superman and all that however the main reason i think the teen titan should be combined with the new teen titan is because i think cassie sandsmark is a more interesting wonder girl who can also serve a greater purpose in helping along other hypothetical plotlines within the dceu for example you could have such that after robin becomes nightwing he decides to leave the team in order to be with and work alongside oracle after she wa crippled with cassie taking leadership of the team in his stead something she ha proven capable of doing a seen when she took charge of the team after winning the vote against robin furthermore cassie also ha a much more straightforward continuity and backstory then donna troy doe thus there would be le convolution there basically my take on it is that i think that the new teen titan is the best version of the team and most obvious choice to get a cinematic adaptation just with the minor edit of adding superboy and replacing donna troy with cassie sandsmark in any case what do you think what version of the teen titan do you believe would work best for the big screen and why

very late to the party but just finished nwh and wanted to share my thought i did manage to avoid most spoiler up until now aside from andrew and tobey so idk how others feel about it overall the movie wa meh i looked up rating after and wa pretty surprised to see how high they were a far a cinema go it wasn t bad but the story is what ruined it for me they pushed the good guy narrative way too far and it wa beyond reason peter ha done questionable thing on an impulse in the past to try to be good and i get that it s part of his character but putting the entire multiverse at risk to save a handful of bad guy knowing that even if you succeed there are infinite universe out there where they are still bad because may said so i just can t wrap my head around how doing that would be worth it no matter how much of a good guy you are this also ruined may s character for me the fact that before she dy she still say trying to help them wa the right thing is just b some other part of the story were also very questionable first wong he showed up in the beginning said keep me out of this and that s it you would think the actual sorcerer supreme would know or care a little more about the multiverse breaking and then there s mj went from a logical but skeptical person to immediately fully trusting peter and not even questioning any of his action especially the scene where she and ned are watching the news after may dy and they re sitting there still wondering if they should push the button i know it s all part of the story and it s what need to happen but it s such a reach in term of how the character and normal people would react also the scene where peter trap strange using math wa extremely cringe yeah they re trying to show peter combining his power with his other skill but still that wa just bad the last half of the movie i m going to be honest i had to pause and have quite a few drink before finishing the writing wa a little clunky but i think it fit kind of well with all spider man the final fight wa pretty boring and just a you d expect a typical hero team up where they struggle at some point but get it together in the end however i did really enjoy watching peter tom beat the crap out of norman it wa such a powerful moment and one of the scene that actually felt genuine and not just there to move the story along overall i would ve liked the movie much more had they not pushed the good guy narrative so hard and i m going to be bold and say that the only reason this movie is rated a well a it is is because of the actor i mean even i had my giddy moment seeing all the villain and spider come in

multiverse of madness gt gt gt love and thunder just watched love and thunder and i m speechless is this the same studio that gave u gem like ragnarok civil war infinity war black panther etc there wa a lot of criticism regarding multiverse of madness mom but that movie at least tried to deliver something whereas this one is slogging in all aspect mom did have a few major drawback but overall it s a visual treat and on first viewing it feel quite well made except for the ending and part of second half maybe only on critically analysing do we really understand the wrong aspect of the movie thor on the other hand is a certified disaster jane foster though she delivers an above average performance who wa absent from the mcu for the last year not counting the s scene in endgame is suddenly brought back to the franchise which i felt is quite needle jane unlike pepper and peggy never felt quite at ease with thor in the first two installment and that wa the reason she wa axed from ragnarok and just look how it turned out instead of bringing her back mcu could have done well to focus on fan favorite valkyrie played by tessa thompson who is reduced to a mere prop in this movie the only good thing in this movie is gorr who get just scene to prove his prowess thankfully christane bale nail that even in the limited time overall his movie may be like the batman and robin of mcu that may be an overstatement but seeing your favorite hero being reduced to such a mess really give you a shitty feeling

the hulk in endgame is a great analogy for mental health and therapy i have seen lot of reference to mental health with other character but i have had this theory that one of the most important theme with mental health for this phase of marvel wa smart hulk we all know hulk is rage and in infinity war hulk didn t want to come out and this led to a battle with banner who then had to use one of the hulk buster suit to participate in the battle in endgame when we first saw smart hulk in the diner he say for year i ve been treating the hulk like he s some kind of disease something to get rid of but then i started looking at him a the cure eighteen month in the gamma lab i put the brain and the brawn together and now look at me best of both world this is important because now we have hulk s strength and banner intelligence at one time which wa imperative for the avenger success when it wa time for someone to snap their finger only hulk could do it and survive if hulk wa in his rage form without banner s mind he would not be able to cognitively control himself to bring everyone back we know from how stark died that no one else would be able to survive maybe thor but he wa dealing with his own grief and a stark said it s not just that that glove is channelling enough energy to light up a continent i m telling you you re in no condition i m currently watching that part a i type and you can even see banner hulk thinking about what he must do and what it could do to him for me this is the perfect analogy for mental health and therapy it is really difficult having a mental heal diagnosis we can t control and oftentimes feel like it control u but through therapy and spending some time getting to understand and know ourselves better we may be able to become a better version of ourselves like banner and hulk did in the gamma lab personally i wa diagnosed with ocd year ago while it suck to have intrusive thought and compulsion a good part of it is intense focus and almost becoming obsessed with thought or a goal or if i don t do this other thing will happen through therapy and lot of difficult epr i can focus that energy on really big goal while i work on not becoming obsessed with that goal i do feel i can use some extra mental processing and problem solving to overcome obstacle i have friend with other mental health challenge expressing similar sentiment after therapy or medication not at all speaking for everyone but it is always an interesting conversation and i have wanted to share this idea of hulk and therapy for a long time thanks for reading

this month mark the seventh year i ve been collecting dc comic seven year ago this month i went to one of the comic shop in my town for the first time i wa year old and had been thoroughly amazed by the comic i had been reading in the graphic novel section of the library mostly batman for the past year there wa something about comic that i had never experienced in any entertainment medium before the cover were always flashy and promising but the story inside could be anything from brightly colored slugfest to moving story about larger than life character i loved all of it and wanted more so i looked for any nearby comic shop on the internet chose the smaller le ostentatious of the two in my town and asked my mom to drive me over to have a look when i walked in there wa a a whole rack of new comic that stretched about half the length of the store plus box and box of back issue from almost every era in comic history there were graphic novel too and paperback collection of series i had only read about online there were collector edition issue a well a some particularly valuable issue that were way out of my price range at the time and many still are beyond that there were plenty of other nerdy delight scattered throughout the shop trading card game tabletop rpgs badass collectible figurine and pretty much anything else one could ever want later i would briefly get into and regularly play magic the gathering at the shop the then mid year old man who run the place knew pretty much everything you could think of about all of it though a bit difficult to deal with at first he helped me understand the basic of the dc universe and where i should start if i wa truly interested in getting into comic this is right after convergence and the end of the new so to say i wa a little lost wa an understatement regardless i purchased my first new comic there detective comic the first issue of the second series to not be a part of the new looking back the storyline of that and the next few issue is god awful jim gordon replaces bruce a the police sanctioned batman for a time but at the time i didn t care i wa so excited to finally be part of something i had tentatively enjoyed for a while now i had the chance to throw myself into this medium and subculture for real and i definitely did year later i m working towards a college degree and generally being an adult but i still love and respect comic i still go to that same shop every week and the other store in town if i have extra money to pick up my pull list i started reading marvel comic too some year back but that s a story for a different time and subreddit i ve definitely changed in the last year and i actually partially credit comic for the good and the difficult during that time in the last year my worldview and understanding of life have changed drastically i wa born into a very conservative christian family i wa rarely exposed to other belief or way of life but i often got glimpse of the outside world through movie and video game comic however had arguably the biggest impact in my life there i wa exposed character of different religion race sexual orientation political view etc i remember reading batwoman elegy year ago it wa one of my first non hostile introduction to the idea that same sex relationship can be enjoyable i remember reading black lightning year one and realizing that i a white person could enjoy comic starring racially diverse character without feeling like i wa being replaced so yeah anyone who say comic shouldn t be diverse is well just wrong it can have a positive effect on reader like me similarly during high school my mental state fell to piece i had no real support from friend or family and therapy or medicine wa hard to come by but i still had comic i got to read story of imperfect hero who often had fragile mental and emotional life but were still able to do superhuman task for the benefit of others it gave me hope and a sense of self that i desperately needed the idea of turning to a favored entertainment medium for support during rough time is often seen a a cliche or worse labeled a escapism but for those really suffering having something to enjoy with no string attached just good story and iconic character can literally be a saving grace i won t be overly dramatic and claim that comic changed my life but they have been a constant source of enjoyment imagination and progress for almost a decade now i ve changed and so have comic but my enjoyment of them ha remained constant i love them now a much if not more than i did in seventh grade when i got the first comic i could call my own and i try to share that love with other people when i can i have a friend who sometimes accompanies me on my comic trip and listens to my moaning about the bat cat wedding that never wa seriously fuck tom king for that i also bring up comic whenever i see someone wearing a piece of clothing with one of my favorite character you never know when somebody wearing a batman logo can end up talking about classic comic for minute with you it s happened more than once all of this to say though i may bitch about dc s refusal to change their sacred status quo or allow batman to be happy i will never get over that wedding i love comic i love the character the story the theme and everything else they bring to the table thanks dc here s to another year and beyond

an honest review of love amp thunder spoiler too much comedy in the movie thor love and thunder just like ragnarok i found to be full of bad comedy that not even a year old would laugh at there wa perhaps or decent joke in there the comedy expertise of taika waititi is doing the thor character more damage than good by turning him back into the moron he wa at the beginning of thor in thor there wa an interesting and serious arc where thor went from a proud and idiotic prince to a much more sensible and caring hero recent movie have turned thor into at best a moron and at worst a joke visuals thor in my opinion also had better presentation than ragnarok the visuals of asgard in the opening of thor were brilliant and truly portrayed asgard a a realm of god and hero while ragnarok simply lack the awe inspiring golden glory of asgard and make it seem more like just another cool planet recent movie have not done thor any favor it wa clear that kenneth branagh had a much more vivid picture of asgard and he wa able to very beautifully translate that picture into film love and thunder wa pretty similar to ragnarok in this way a few thor like visuals of omnipotent city would have been quite alluring although the few that we did see were pretty beautiful the visuals of new asgard were perfect also creating a perfectly appropriate earth asgard mix the visual of valhalla in the post credit scene wa utterly beautiful and didn t have the flashiness of asgard presenting it a the perfect resting place for god this humble yet glorious image of valhalla made it an immediately recognisable heavenly realm that the viewer felt at ease in portrayal of the greek god zeus wa not presented too great or too poorly his behaviour wa very much in line with the zeus of mythology and i wa very pleased with his showy and selfish attitude drawing a clear difference between the greek and norse god the accent wa quite bad making him sound strangely italian ish rather than greek i think there wa an attempt to give him a greek accent but they should ve taken the asgardian route and given him a british or american accent instead a it would ve sounded le broken and more realistic i loved the glimpse of dionysus whose costume made it immediately obvious who he wa the woman around zeus also helped to show off zeus personality and despite not having speaking role they had an important part to play in zeus scene gorr s portrayal one great point of the movie wa gorr s portrayal christian bale presented the character very well and gorr s humour wa most powerful a he wa so dark and terrifying especially in the scene where he killed the snake his more emotional moment with his daughter felt so real and made me actually like him although i m not a fan of what the movie did with love at the end many prop to christian bale and india rose hemsworth who played love yes she is chris hemsworth s daughter in real life for their acting in this movie the use of jane while the post credit scene set up jane s eventual return a a valkyrie i think the mighty thor wa an interesting character a her weakness in her mortal form gave her a perfect reason to keep wielding mjolnir i would have preferred to keep the character for a few movie before killing her off a her arc in this movie felt too rushed towards her death but her death gave u that amazing visual of heimdall and valhalla so i really can t complain conclusion a lot of the acting in this movie wa magnificent and the movie had a few beautiful visuals that managed to make up for some of the more lackluster visuals we were given in ragnarok bale especially stood out and it is a shame we won t get to see more of him in the mcu i loved him in the dark knight trilogy and it is good to see that ten year later bale still ha what it take to make a superhero movie amazing in my opinion taika waititi specialises in comedy and his intentionally funny movie are absolutely amazing but the thor character wa not supposed to be funny therefore i feel that he wa the wrong choice for this movie franchise and that marvel either need to tone down the comedy or bring back kenneth branagh the excessive attempt at comedy continued from ragnarok and did make the movie a bit le enjoyable breaking up the flow of seriousness with thing like the screaming goat and the i want to feel shitty about you line the latter being said a if he wa a kid trying to confess to his first crush even though he already know jane extremely well but overall a pretty good movie i don t think it stand on a par with multiverse of madness but it is one of the best movie i have seen by general standard and therefore wa quite enjoyable there are a few improvement i hope to see in thor s next movie but nothing too major

exclusive variant cover going against pride initiative just a note before getting into my thought here i don t usually write these opinion based post and my point is not to sway anyone s opinion on sexuality so i apologize if i offend anyone in advance that is not my intention after seeing the th retailer exclusive variant cover for the poison ivy mini series that just came out earlier this month i started to get a sense of maybe how ironic it wa that we ve got all these pride based book promoting lgbtqia and the only pride based book getting retailer variant is poison ivy go to show where the market is at from a sexuality perspective i e heterosexual men with a secondary audience of anyone else who sexually prefers woman we didn t get any retailer variant for the pride collection nor the tim drake special that just came out this week and i d argue the story in each of those book were just a great to read to try to be mildly objective i wouldn t think poison ivy and harley quinn are more popular than the sum of all the character shown in the pride collection combined doe this suggest that the pride book don t sell or are retailer who pitch for exclusive not into the pride scene and even dare i say homophobic or is dc holding back on retailer making exclusive cover for pride based book this month with clear exception to poison ivy it just seems ironic that there s this big pride agenda from dc marvel other publisher and retailer don t seem to be making an effort to promote that retailer exclusive variant are usually an indication of which book are expected to sell at least based on the assumption that retailer have purposely invested in exclusive cover artwork to sell a unique version of the book so the decision to offer an exclusive cover is calculated to some degree
